issue.title: [Java] Create a new java/contrib module
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7534](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7534). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
To better clarify the status of java sub-modules, create a contrib module and move the following modules underneath it.

- algorithm
- adapter
- plasma

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7534?focusedCommentId=17012579) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield@gmail.com):*
Is it possible to just create a contrib directory and move the existing modules there?  There is already documentation for each module noting its maturity.  Its also not clear to me how we actually measure usage.  For instance, the JDBC adapter seems to have some usage I believe  `[~uwe]`  even wrote a blog post about it.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7534?focusedCommentId=17013823) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
The JDBC adapter is used actively, properly still only by a small set of users. Should they really live in a contrib module or would adapters not be sufficient?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7534?focusedCommentId=17084379) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield@gmail.com):*
Issue resolved by pull request 6812
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6812>
